## ytdl

**Parameters**

-   `link` **[string][33]** 
-   `options` **![Object][34]** 

Returns **ReadableStream** 

### InstallMiniGet

Chooses a format to download.

**Parameters**

-   `miniget`  
-   `minipromise`  
-   `stream` **[stream.Readable][35]** 
-   `info` **[Object][34]** 
-   `options` **[Object][34]** 

### InstallMiniGet

Can be used to download video after its `info` is gotten through
`ytdl.getInfo()`. In case the user might want to look at the
`info` object before deciding to download.

**Parameters**

-   `miniget`  
-   `minipromise`  
-   `info` **[Object][34]** 
-   `options` **![Object][34]** 

Returns **ReadableStream**

-   `id` **[string][33]** 
-   `options` **[Object][34]**

## sortFormats

Sort formats from highest quality to lowest.
By resolution, then video bitrate, then audio bitrate.

**Parameters**

-   `a` **[Object][34]** 
-   `b` **[Object][34]** 

Returns **[number][38]** 

## chooseFormat

Choose a format depending on the given options.

**Parameters**

-   `formats` **[Array][37]&lt;[Object][34]>** 
-   `options` **[Object][34]** 


-   Throws **[Error][39]** when no format matches the filter/format rules

Returns **[Object][34]**

-   `left` **[string][33]** 
-   `right` **[string][33]** 

Returns **[string][33]** 

## getVideoID

Gets video ID either from a url or by checking if the given string
matches the video ID format.

**Parameters**

-   `str` **[string][33]** 


-   Throws **[Error][39]** If unable to find a id
-   Throws **[TypeError][41]** If videoid doesn't match specs

Returns **[string][33]** 

## validateURL

Checks wether the input string includes a valid id.

**Parameters**

-   `string` **[string][33]** 

Returns **[boolean][42]**

## getFormatByQuality

Gets a format based on quality or array of quality's

**Parameters**

-   `quality` **([string][33] | \[[string][33]])** 
-   `formats` **\[[Object][34]]** 

Returns **[Object][34]** 

## sortFormatsSimple

Sort's the provided formats - highest bitrate first

**Parameters**

-   `formats` **\[[Object][34]]** 
-   `audioOnly` **[boolean][42]** look at audio score instead of video bitrate (optional, default `false`)

Returns **\[[Object][34]]** 

## validQueryDomains

Get video ID.

There are a few type of video URL formats.

-   [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VIDEO_ID][43]
-   [https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=VIDEO_ID][44]
-   [https://youtu.be/VIDEO_ID][45]
-   [https://www.youtube.com/v/VIDEO_ID][46]
-   [https://www.youtube.com/embed/VIDEO_ID][47]
-   [https://music.youtube.com/watch?v=VIDEO_ID][48]
-   [https://gaming.youtube.com/watch?v=VIDEO_ID][49]

**Parameters**

-   `link` **[string][33]** 


-   Throws **[Error][39]** If unable to find a id
-   Throws **[TypeError][41]** If videoid doesn't match specs

Returns **[string][33]** 

## idRegex

Returns true if given id satifies YouTube's id format.

**Parameters**

-   `id` **[string][33]** 

Returns **[boolean][42]** 

## formats

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/YouTube#Quality_and_formats][50]

## getTokens

Extract signature deciphering tokens from html5player file.

**Parameters**

-   `html5playerfile` **[string][33]** 
-   `options` **[Object][34]** 

Returns **[Promise][36]&lt;[Array][37]&lt;[string][33]>>** 

## decipher

Decipher a signature based on action tokens.

**Parameters**

-   `tokens` **[Array][37]&lt;[string][33]>** 
-   `sig` **[string][33]** 

Returns **[string][33]** 

## extractActions

Extracts the actions that should be taken to decipher a signature.

This searches for a function that performs string manipulations on
the signature. We already know what the 3 possible changes to a signature
are in order to decipher it. There is

-   Reversing the string.
-   Removing a number of characters from the beginning.
-   Swapping the first character with another position.

Note, `Array#slice()` used to be used instead of `Array#splice()`,
it's kept in case we encounter any older html5player files.

After retrieving the function that does this, we can see what actions
it takes on a signature.

**Parameters**

-   `body` **[string][33]** 

Returns **[Array][37]&lt;[string][33]>** 

## setDownloadURL

**Parameters**

-   `format` **[Object][34]** 
-   `sig` **[string][33]** 

## decipherFormats

Applies `sig.decipher()` to all format URL's.

**Parameters**

-   `formats` **[Array][37]&lt;[Object][34]>** 
-   `html5player` **[string][33]** 
-   `options` **[Object][34]** 

## swapHeadAndPosition

Swaps the first element of an array with one of given position.

**Parameters**

-   `arr` **[Array][37]&lt;[Object][34]>** 
-   `position` **[number][38]** 

Returns **[Array][37]&lt;[Object][34]>**
